result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth L Holeton Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay restitution during the pendancy of probation.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.

Defendant Kenneth L Holeton in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Upon pl to Ct 14, 270 days RCJ, $600.00 + cc, DLR; Ct 8-w/held sent; 2 yrs prob. Stipulation for requested restitution for $1181.14 payable to Kutzler Express, Inc.
P-G to both
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilty

BTC: guilty as above. Ct 8: sent w/held - 2 yrs prob. 6 mo DLR
                                    Ct 14: 270 days RCJ/CFTS. Huber is granted for employment. Do not report late or under the influence of alc/cs. $600.00 + cc, 2 yr DLR, 1 yr IID upon licensure, 
                                              DNA sample & costs, IS eligible for CIP and SAP. 

**DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY**

Conditions:
obey all rules and regs
restitution - $1,181.14 to Kutzler Express Inc
costs
DNA sample if not already provided & costs
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's
any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care
May not to have any alcohol in his home
not to go into taverns, bars or liquor stores. May go to restaurants that sell alcohol but may not consume same

FAW/vote

IS eligible for CIP and SAP
ZCI

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victims, JMG, RKM, SLZ  (person, property, residence or family).   Do not drive at all.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.   Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - report to 524 S Main Street, Third Floor (262-632-1780).  You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 10-06-2015;   Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor/House arrest through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Defendant may not drive ANY vehicle.

AMENDED 10-21-2015-Defendant may attend medical and treatment appointments in Racine County, court hearings and attorney visits in Racine County, may go to Racine County Workforce Development Center and to the Racine County Child Support Agency. The defendant must notify ZCI when he will leave his home and must check in with ZCI when he returns to his home.

AMENDED 11-04-2015: DEFENDANT MAY ATTEND COURT IN DUPAGE COUNTY, ILLINOIS AND MEET WITH HIS ATTORNEY IN ILLINOIS PROVIDED DEFENDANT NOTIFIES THE COURT AND ZCI OF ALL DATES AND TIMES. THE DEFENDANT SHALL NOTIFY ZCI WHEN HE LEAVES AND WHEN HE RETURNS HOME.

AMENDED 02-01-2016 - DEFENDANT MAY HAVE NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH VICTIM.

AMENDED 03-10-2016: GPS MAY BE REMOVED. SCRAM REMAINS.

Defendant Kenneth L Holeton in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Defendant Kenneth L Holeton in custody.  Jennifer C Tanck-Adams for Lillian Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense files motion to modify bond to $10,000.00. Deft does not oppose GPS. The State's concern is the deft's prior OWI conditions and indicates that at the very least if the Court orders bond lowered that SCRAM be installed, however, the State does object to the bond being modified.

BTC: Bond modification is granted. Bond may be modified to $10,000.00 cash. Same terms and conditions with the addtion of SCRAM and GPS/house arrest. Deft not to drive ANY vehicle.
